page.title: 04INDUSTRY 1.
page.content: In the past the area relied on its natural resources for work - farming, coal and clay - as coal and clay have worked out and farming became more mechanised the area was very much in decline. The New Town brought a revival in industry and hope for people. The big firms, attracted by large grants and concessions, moved in taking on 1000's of people to work in metal extrusion, textiles, electronics and rubber. These closed down very quickly after the grants ceased and at the start of the recession. These big empty buildings are now used for storage. The demise of these factories brought severe unemployment and people moving to other areas. The smaller firms, employing less than 200, have continued successfully both expanding and increasing in number 18 such industries exist in the area.
